description:
West Hollywood Community Housing Corporation is an award winning developer of affordable housing in the City of West Hollywood and the greater Los Angeles area. The Accounts Receivable/Accounts Payable Clerk will assist the Controller with clerical duties, reports and projects to ensure that the objectives and goals of WHCHC’s mission are achieved. The Accounts Receivable/Accounts Payable Clerk is expected to work both independently and with direction, as well as collaborate with other team members.

Essential Duties

  • Process approved vendor invoices
  • Mail checks to vendors
  • Maintain vendor payment files and W-9 binder
  • Maintain supporting documentation for HOPWA resident services contract
  • Prepare partnership expense reimbursement requests
  • Record credit card charges
  • Generate service invoices
  • Make bank deposits and record cash receipts
  • Gather information for annual 1099 forms
  • Prepare worksheet for annual CA use tax return
  • Assist with annual audits
  • Assist with other tasks and special projects as needed

Education/Experience/Skill Set

  • Proficient use of accounting software – Sage 50 (formerly Peachtree)
  • Proficient use of Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Outlook
  • Excellent communication skills – written, oral and interpersonal
  • Highest level of personal integrity and ethical standards
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to establish priorities and work independently in a proactive manner
  • Ability to perform repetitive tasks with a high degree of accuracy
  • Basic math skills and understanding of accounts payable procedures
  • Flexible to assist where needed
  • College degree with at least five years of experience

Work Environment/Equipment Used

The work environment will usually be in-person, in a professional office setting, with possible shared workspace. The noise level is usually quiet to moderate. The individual in this position may operate any or all of the following: standard office equipment including personal computer, photocopier and personal automobile.

Physical Activity

The Accounts Receivable/Accounts Payable Clerk is required to talk, see and hear. In the course of performing this job, the Accounts Receivable/Accounts Payable Clerk typically spends time sitting, standing, walking, stooping, kneeling, crouching, climbing stairs, listening/speaking, writing, and operating a personal computer and personal automobile. The Accounts Receivable/Accounts Payable Clerk must possess the ability to lift up to 25 lbs.

Company Description

West Hollywood Community Housing Corporation (WHCHC) is a non-profit real estate developer that has been creating affordable housing for low-income seniors, working families and people with special needs for over 35 years. WHCHC’s mission is building housing and providing services that move people from insecurity to stability.
